results.deck: Billiard game.
results.name: Pool Shark 2

results.deck: Japanese game.
results.name: Triangle Again

results.deck: Japanese game.
results.name: Triangle Again 2

results.deck: Ultimate Pro Pinball is a pinball game, offering the player a choice of three different tables.  Released on Xbox, PS2 and PC.  The game was never given a US release on any platform.
results.name: Ultimate Pro Pinball

results.deck: Jikkyou World Soccer 2002 is a Soccer Sim game, developed by Konami and published by net mobile AG, which was released in Japan.
results.name: Jikkyou World Soccer 2002

results.deck: A visual novel PSP video game by Otomate.
results.name: Death Connection

results.deck: A puzzle action RPG developed by Falcom.
results.name: Zwei!!

results.deck: Side story that takes place during the original Hakuoki game, expanding on background events not previously shown and detailing Chizuru's daily life with the Shinsengumi.
results.name: Hakuoki Zuisouroku

results.deck: G1 Jockey 3 is a thoroughbred horse racing simulation video game produced by Koei for the PlayStation 2. Although the G1 Jockey series had been gaining popularity in Japan, this was the first game in the series to be released in North America. In contrast to Tecmo's Gallop Racer series, which focuses on every aspect of horse racing (including breeding), G1 Jockey 3 focuses solely on the jockey.
results.name: G1 Jockey 3

results.deck: G1 Jockey 4 lets players take the reins and experience the feeling of being a top racehorse jockey. This fourth game in the hugely popular series introduces a new ranking system and abilities, as well a revolutionary analogue control system.
results.name: G1 Jockey 4

results.deck: Once upon a time, a long-time maker of serious strategy games came up with the idea of filling their games with waifus.
results.name: Sengoku Hime: Senran no Yo ni Honoo Tatsu

results.deck: A prequel to the main Hakuoki game, it tells the story of a young man who falls in with the Rōshigumi and is there for the founding of the Shinsengumi.
results.name: Hakuoki Reimeiroku

results.deck: A pachinko game based off the Sakura Taisen franchise.
results.name: Jissen Pachinko Hisshouhou! CR Sakura Taisen

results.deck: The second game in the Dance:UK series.
results.name: Dance:UK eXtra TraX

results.deck: The third game in the Dance:UK series.
results.name: Dance:UK XL

results.deck: The third game in the Dance:UK series.
results.name: Dance:UK XL Party

results.deck: X-Treme Express: World Grand Prix is an arcade-style train racing game developed by Syscom that was self-published in Japan and published by Midas Interactive Entertainment in Europe. Players conduct one of several dozen trains representing multiple nations as they speed to the train platform at the end of each stage while knocking competitors off the rail tracks and attempting to maintain balance on their own car.
results.name: X-Treme Express: World Grand Prix

results.deck: The fourth entry in Sega's J-League soccer management simulator.
results.name: J-League Pro Soccer Club o Tsukurou! '04

results.deck: Take Europe with storm using your very own army of Nazi cuties, in this offshoot of the Daisenryaku series of turn-based strategy games.
results.name: Moe Moe 2-ji Daisenryaku

results.deck: Visual novel developed by F&C.
results.name: Suigetsu

results.deck: The third major Pia Carrot game, taking place a year after the second.
results.name: Pia Carrot e Youkoso!! 3

results.deck: Fire fighting game for the PlayStation 2. There are 30 floors in Clayton Tower for you to explore, your goal being to rescue as many survivors as possible.
results.name: Fire Heroes

results.deck: Super Robot Taisen: Scramble Commander comes from the series Super Robot Taisen and it's the first HD entry.
results.name: Super Robot Taisen: Scramble Commander

results.deck: Football Kingdom: Trial Edition is a soccer game developed by Namco, released in Japan for the Playstation 2 in 2004.
results.name: Football Kingdom Trial Edition

results.deck: The Sword of Etheria is a hack-and-slash action-adventure game for the PlayStation 2, released in Japan in 2005 and 2006 in Europe.
results.name: The Sword of Etheria

results.deck: Football management game based on the 2005/2006 season. Featuring 6 of the top leagues from Europe.
results.name: Pro Evolution Soccer Management

results.deck: Starting as an amateur footballer by training hard and making correct career choices you can gradually become a world famous professional. Apart from the football side of your career you will also be able to manage aspects of your personal life, including friendships and rivalry, dating, marriage and even raising children.
results.name: Soccer Life!

results.deck: Keyboardmania II combines the second and third arcade releases of the Keyboardmania series.
results.name: Keyboardmania II: 2ndMIX and 3rdMIX

results.deck: Mahjong Taikai III is the PlayStation 2 entry in Koei's mahjong series.
results.name: Mahjong Taikai III

results.deck: Initial D: Takahashi Ryosuke no Typing Saisoku Riron is a typing tutor game for the PlayStation 2, based on the Initial D anime.
results.name: Initial D: Takahashi Ryosuke no Typing Saisoku Riron
Tsuki no Hikari: Shizumeru Kane no Satsujin

results.deck: The 2002 entry in the college basketball franchise.
results.name: NCAA March Madness 2002

results.deck: Hudson Selection Vol. 3: PC Genjin is a cel-shaded remake of PC Genjin ("Bonk's Adventure")
results.name: Hudson Selection Vol. 3: PC Genjin

results.deck: MMORPG based on Koei's long running Nobunaga's Ambition franchise. Launched in 2003 on the PlayStation 2, it will soon move to it's third generation of Sony hardware when the PlayStation 4 version debuts.

results.deck: Leo Tsushima's life gets turned upside down when his beautiful and fierce cousin decides to move in with him in this comedic visual novel.

results.deck: Leo Tsushima's continues to get more interesting as a new girl joins his class in the second Tsuyokiss visual novel.
results.name: Tsuyokiss 2gakki

results.deck: A PlayStation 2 visual novel and 5pb's first venture into making games.

results.deck: Rakushou! Pachi-Slot Sengen 2 is the second in the Rakushou! Pachi-Slot Sengen console series.
results.name: Rakushou! Pachi-Slot Sengen 2

results.deck: Tecmo comes back for another round of pachi-slot games.
results.name: Rakushou! Pachi-Slot Sengen 3

results.deck: The final PS2 entry in the Rakushou! Pachi-Slot Sengen series before it began focusing solely on Rio.

results.name: Yamasa Digi World: Collaboration SP Pachi-Slot Ridge Racer

results.deck: Hunter X Hunter is a Japanese adventure game for the PS2. Many characters from the Hunter X Hunter universe are playable in this sidecrolling beat-em-up.

results.deck: Visual novel about seven worst students at the Suzunone Magic School, who are faced with the prospect of getting kicked out unless they pass a special trial.
results.name: Suzunone Seven!

results.deck: Pachi-Slot King! Kagaku Ninja-Tai Gatchaman is a PlayStation 2 pachinko/slot machine game based on the Gatchaman anime.

results.deck: Plus Plum 2 is a Puzzle game, published by Takuyo.

results.deck: A visual novel about a beast tamer that buys 4 animals that turn out to be something more than what she expected.

results.deck: Part of the NEO GEO Online Collection. A PS2 re-release of the SNK 2d edo-period fighters, collecting The Last Blade 1 and The Last Blade 2
results.name: The Last Blade 1 and 2

results.deck: An alternate retelling of the original Fushigi Yuugi story, with two new girls taking the place of Miaka and Yui.
results.name: Fushigi Yuugi Suzaku Ibun

results.deck: Sequel to the L no Kisetsu visual novel.
results.name: L no Kisetsu 2: Invisible Memories

results.deck: The first fishing game released on the PS2 and features the ability to explore 5 different lakes.
results.name: BASS Strike

results.deck: PachiPara 13: Super Umi to Pachipro Fūunroku is a Japanese exclusive PS2 installment in Irem's long-running pachinko simulation franchise. As in other PS2 entries in the series, it also features a story-driven open world RPG mode for those wanting to play more than just pachinko.
results.name: PachiPara 13: Super Umi to Pachipro Fūunroku

results.deck: Kamen Rider 555 is a fighting game based on the TV series of the same name.
results.name: Kamen Rider 555

results.deck: Kamen Rider: Seigi no Keifu is an adventure-brawler with Kamen Rider from many different eras.
results.name: Kamen Rider: Seigi no Keifu

results.deck: Another pachi-slot game starring Kamen Rider.
results.name: Pachitte Chonmage Tatsujin 5: CR Kamen Rider

results.deck: PachiPara 14: Kaze to Kumo to Super Umi in Okinawa is the last of Irem's Japan-only pachinko simulators to appear on the PS2. It also features the last open world RPG iteration of the PachiPro Fūunroku subseries to date prior to transitioning into the visual novel genre.
results.name: PachiPara 14: Kaze to Kumo to Super Umi in Okinawa

results.deck: A direct response to the first X-Games snowboarding game, 2002 tries to straddle a pick up and play feel with some simulation mechanics built on top.
results.name: ESPN Winter X-Games Snowboarding 2002

results.deck: A rally racing game for the PlayStation 2
results.name: Global Touring Challenge: Africa

results.deck: Motorcycle racing game for the PlayStation 2

results.deck: The second in Nippon Ichi's urban legend themed visual novels, continues the young police detective's investigations into mysterious and gruesome incidents.
results.name: Hayarigami 2: Toshidensetsu Kaii Jiken

results.deck: A four-player fighting game developed by Saffire for the Xbox, PS2, and GameCube. Its gameplay drew comparisons to Power Stone, though not many favorable ones.

results.deck: Horse simulator game based on the Melbourne cup.

results.name: Happy! Happy!! Boarders in Hokkaido

results.name: Tokyo Xtreme Racer Drift

results.deck: Secret of Evangelion is an investigative adventure game in the Shinseiki Evangelion universe. Players control of take NERV intelligence agent Kenzaki Kyouya as he unravels mysteries and flirts with Dummy Plug pilots.
